page.title: 16SHEERNESS LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: {THE LIFEBOAT STATION}WAS OPENED IN 1969. THERE ARE 2 BOATS - AN OFFSHORE BOAT AND AN ONSHORE ONE.THE OFFSHORE BOAT STAYS IN THE WATER ALL THE TIME -SHE IS CALLED THE{"HELEN TURNBULL" AND IS 10 YEARS OLD. THE EQUIPMENT ON THE LIFEBOAT IS: RADAR, VHF RADIO, A FEW BLANKETS, FIRST AID KIT AND A STRETCHER.THE BOAT HAS A SPEED OF 15 KNOTS. THE CREW OF 12 WEAR OILSKINS, TROUSERS, PLASTIC BOOTS,PROTECTIVE HATS. THE STATION HAS VHF RADIO. THE MOST IMPORTANT RESCUE THE SHEERNESS LIFEBOAT HAS PERFORMED IS WHEN THEY SAVED 3 MEN FROM A SINKING CABIN CRUISER IN THE WINTER OF 1982. THEY ARE KEPT BUSY IN SUMMER MONTHS RESCUING YACHTSMEN AND SAILBOARDERS WHO OFTEN GET INTO DIFFICULTIES IN THE TRICKY CURRENTS OFF SHEPPEY.
